definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
see 嗤之以鼻[chi1 zhi1 yi3 bi2]

sentences.english: It is tempting to dismiss this trite formulation as a meaningless excuse for inaction.
sentences.chinese: 這種陳詞濫調很容易被嗤爲不作爲的空洞藉口。
他聽了這個笑話嗤嗤地笑了起來。
他聽了這個笑話嗤嗤地笑了起來。

sentences.english: The next moment the first wave came, swallowing the whole factory.
sentences.chinese: 緊接着第一波海浪就到了，一下子就吞嗤整個工廠。

sentences.english: You may sneer , but a lot of people like this kind of music.
sentences.chinese: 你可能會嗤之一鼻，但是有很多人喜歡這種音樂。

sentences.english: I don't like the way you slurp noisily when you eat noodles.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡你吃麪條時的“嗤嘍”聲。

sentences.english: Green laughed softly, and lowered her head coyly .
sentences.chinese: 阿珂嗤的一笑，低下頭去。

definition: (onom.) giggling/breathing/tearing of paper, ripping of fabric etc
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
hiss/neigh/Ss! (sound of air sucked between the teeth, indicating hesitation or thinking over)
(old)(interjection expressing disapproval, commiseration etc) tut!/Taiwan pr. [duo4]
to blow (as of wind)/sound of wind/sough
to sting or bite (of mosquito, bee etc)/to say repeatedly/to urge insistently/to ask repeatedly/to stick to a point/(onom.) tinkling or jingling sound
